Lost and Found (G)
  Find something? Lost something? This is a place where you can drop all owned 
items and let a player find it themselves! Find a portal? Find a Viper Belt?

Drop it here.

 Please keep in mind reboots and or crashes will dispose
of these items just like anywhere else in the mud.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 


n
The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

whispering incantations.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
s
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

w
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) EmJay the Shaman.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

2297/2534 HP  1642/3110 MP  2146/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2871443 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (Marked) (White Aura) (OPK) Tinada the Chronicler [R/C].

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

East of the Aylorian Church Altar
  You stand on the east side of the altar in the grand Aylorian Church.  To
the north is a large wooden door that leads out to the Templar's Road of
Andolar.  To the east is a small nook with golden curtains cascading from
ceiling to floor.  A large mithril throne stands in the middle of the room
on which sits a man dressed head to toe in leather armor.  Women to his left
and right fawn over him, cooing and giggling like school girls.

Mist-Shrouded Moorland (2124)

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

[ Exits: north down ]
A field hand is here, trying to earn a living.

The Darkening Path
  Great oaks, with hoary trunks and leaf-laden branches border the path that 
leads up a steep hillside northwards. A cliff looms, and upon it, castle 
battlements rise. The stone walls of the castle appear impenetrable, and 
solemn.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Stairwell

The West Side of the Bridge (2146)

The Entrance of the Bridge
  What did I just say: Do not enter the room! Ooh well, stay and play with 
whomever (or whatever) has time for that. And now that you're here, you might
as well solve some mysteries in this place. For the description of the room: 
When you enter the bridge, you notice a large window, filling the north wall.
It must be a thrill to watch all kinds of spectacular things happen through 
that window. Hey wait! One just appeared. It seems that you have fallen with 
your nose in the butter!

The Storm Cruiser, Tempest

Storm Ships of Lem-Dagor. Of course this is the famous cruiser, Tempest,

is a big sign for you to read.

Inside the trader, Typhoon
  You find yourself in a ship, full of opportunities. But don't let the Typhoon
captain catch you here! He can be very nasty after a full bottle of whiskey.
But that's only if he is awakened from his drunken stupor. So this is one of 
the famous trade ships of Lem-Dagor. It's not very impressive right now, as 
it doesn't seem to have a very valuable cargo at the moment.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

[ Exits: north east ]

leaves.

Deep in the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

Deeper into the ironwoods (2137)

Deep in the ironwood forest (2136)

Deep in the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

Deep in the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Open Field
  You are standing in the middle of a vast field.  It would be a
run-of-the-mill field, except for the fact that there's a strange object of
immense size hovering overhead.  The beautiful flying work of art appears to
be a flying ship.  What's even more interesting, is there is a rope ladder
which hangs down from the side of the ship.  It's the perfect invitation for
you to enter.

You clutch the rope ladder tightly and pull yourself into the ship.

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Beginning of the Stairwell
  This is the beginning of the stairwell, the top of the backbone of the
airship.  Enough room is granted to allow for plenty of traffic along this
vital passageway.  The airship expands to the north, west, and east.  To the
south, you can see the quarters for the higher-ranking officers who are in
control of the airship.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Out of the tunnels
  As you look around, you wonder if this is any better then the tunnels. 
The ground is twisted and broken, a plain filled with death.  Bones litter
the surface, hundreds of creatures must've died here.  The sky fills you
with unease as it casts an eerie array of colors around you.  You decide to
keep your eyes down since watching the clouds above you boil fills you with
nausea.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (White Aura) EmJay the Shaman.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Cardo Maximus
  As you enter the city gates, you notice some of the beauty and luxury
Pompeii offers.  Under your feet, the street is paved with smooth limestone,
and elaborately constructed buildings are all around.  To the west, you see
a sign on a door.  To the north, the city waits to be explored.  Bronze
oil lanterns in each doorway light the street and allow the spectacular
murals on the walls to be seen.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) EmJay the Shaman.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

  This silvery strand of starlight slithers through the sky, making very

if it were created for some forgotten race.  Now it just shimmers, strewn
through the stars, guiding those who travel, near or far.  Phact is directly
north from here, Altais beside it, while Izar is in the southeast.

Out of the tunnels
  As you look around, you wonder if this is any better then the tunnels. 
The ground is twisted and broken, a plain filled with death.  Bones litter
the surface, hundreds of creatures must've died here.  The sky fills you
with unease as it casts an eerie array of colors around you.  You decide to
keep your eyes down since watching the clouds above you boil fills you with
nausea.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Ancient Reman Road (2119)

A Twisted and Cracked Ancient Road
  Lone and bare, the level sands stretch and twist to the edges of
vision.  Like slow ocean breakers they crash against the rocky shores of
this desert sea.  Ancient bleached bones sit like shipwrecks high upon the
rocks that thrust through the sandy waves, beckoning like sirens of old
those weary travellers to their thirsty doom.  A cracked and ancient road
rides through the wastes like a bridge over a troubled sea, twisting on
motionless waves of sand until it disappears into the haze of the east.  
A small weather beaten and blasted marker sits half buried by the all
encompassing sands.  Its barely legible words state '20 miles to Reme.'

Palace Entrance (G) (2133)

Palace Gardens
  You push through green shrouded pillars, into a garden such as Kublai
Khan might have enjoyed.  Plants stream downwards like a living waterfall
across the smooth marbled textures of the wall.  Small carved fountains hold
exotic water plants, while magical songbirds dance and sing in streams of
fire in the air.  Truly a magical garden in a magical city.

>>    *[NOEXP]* WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The edge of a steamy marsh (G)
  As you turn off the swampy path, you realize that the loggers back in Aylor 
were not as drunk as they should have been from all the Firebreather they had
been drinking. Clearly visible, now that the loggers have chopped through the
undergrowth and the trees, is the trail you followed to see for yourself if 
the wild stories the loggers were telling were spun out of firebreather, or 
if a real adventure could be here. You stand at the very edge of the steaming
wetland, hearing the small chitterings, buzzings and splashes that are 
associated with places such as this; however, there is also a very faint 
chanting on the breeze that doesn't belong here. As you look around, you 
notice that like any marshland or wetland, this one is full of greenery, 
though there is a multitude of colors from flowers, insects, and decay mixed 
with the trees. As you continue to look, you notice three paths branching 
from this point, going deeper into the marsh, and of course, the way back to 
the swampy path.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A medium sized turtle makes its home in the marshes.
The dragonfly zips around the marshlands.

n
A muddy path
  The path you are following is a sign of things to come it would seem. 
The trees here are tall, their large roots poking through the brown mud that
serves as a path.  The sounds of insects and chittering animals begins to
surround you as you move deeper into the marsh, and the heat mixed with
water vapor makes the air shimmer.  There is a light breeze, but it is by no
means a cooling one.  Through the trees to the left and right you can barely
make out dark, shady-looking pools of water.  The sound of frogs and other
aquatic animals drift to your ears.  Still the chanting continues, you
remember the loggers mentioning the chanting as well, and they also
mentioned dangers; fierce tribal lizardmen, and something about large rats
and moving trees.  Ahead the path continues deeper into the steamy quagmire,
though you can still return to the edge of this untamed land and try another
path or simply leave before you find those lizardmen.  

[ Exits: north south ]
     Delicate with an enchanting fragrance, these flowers brighten up the marshlands.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.
A garter snake suns itself on a rock.
(Hidden) A tree frog sits here singing melodiously.
Exhausted, Golothian, the giant woodsman, waits for the marshlands to claim him.

1633/2534 HP  108/3110 MP  2145/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2892119 | A muddy path (NS)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* Through dense vegetation
  The vegetation here has grown up over what little path there was in this
swamp.  Thick brown tree trunks block both east and west travel, and vines
with brightly colored flowers cover the path, along with several other
plants.  Moss grows all over everything here, and fungi of all sorts seem to
spring out of every crevice and crack in the bark of the trees and vines. 
It is extremely dark here, and the air is heavy with humidity and the scents
of flourishing undergrowth.  Ahead it looks as if this vegetation will
recede again and let in light.  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Hidden) (Red Aura) (White Aura) Covered in mud, a warty old marsh hag eyes you.
(Golden Aura) An Elven hunter seems right at home in the trees.

1633/2534 HP  108/3110 MP  2144/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2892119 | Through dense vegetation (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Opening in the undergrowth
  Here the undergrowth is less than to the south, the path slopes up
slightly, and the mud is a little drier than in the surrounding area.  From
here you can see a bit farther in all directions.  To the north, and
slightly east, you can see the sparkling of sunlight on water, though only
brief glimpses of the body of water through the many trees that surround it.
There appears to be some form of rock formation directly north, though it is
covered in moss and plant life.  To the west, you see some sort of thorny
plant with long spines, and it does not look possible to penetrate the
undergrowth in that direction, even if you did wish to risk your skin on
those spines.  

[ Exits: east south ]
(Hidden) A small wolf stalks the marshlands for prey.
(Hidden) A small wolf stalks the marshlands for prey.

1633/2534 HP  108/3110 MP  2143/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2892119 | Opening in the undergrowth (ES)
e
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* On a well used path
  As you walk along this path, you notice faint signs of tracks.  Also
there are some discarded tools lying in the mud off to one side of the
trail.  It strikes you suddenly that this is the first time you can truly
call any cleared path in this marsh a trail.  There are still tall, thick
trees with vines and flowers growing around them, and the trail is still
dotted with shallow dips where water has collected, but it has been cleared
of most of the vegetation that thrives in the steamy climate.  To the east,
thick undergrowth and vines block any passage, except perhaps by the small
animals who call the marshlands home, while west will take you back to the
slight rise in the land.  North you can now plainly see the large lake,
though it is still a ways off.  The mound you first noticed on your way
along the path rises to the west and just to the north.  There is a faint
sound of rustling and hissing coming from farther to the north.  

[ Exits: north west ]
(Golden Aura) An Elven hunter seems right at home in the trees.
(Red Aura) An enormous mud-colored giant crashes through the marshlands.
(Hidden) A tree frog sits here singing melodiously.
A brilliantly blue feathered bird catches your eye.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A Lizardman is nearly invisible in the trees.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A brutish Lizardman moves silently through the marsh.

1633/2534 HP  108/3110 MP  2142/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2892119 | On a well used path (NW)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* Close to a lake
  From here you can see the lake more clearly than before.  Thick
vegetation is all around, but you notice that the trees on the lakeshore are
not growing quite so close together.  West from here the mound has an
opening, and appears to be a den of some sort.  The hissing and rustling you
heard is coming from inside the mound, and there are a lot of tracks leading
in and out of the opening.  There are still trees to the east and it appears
that one or two are dead, there are a couple of logs on the ground, covered
in fungi and moss which glows a soft green.  The scent of mud, decaying
vegetation and water fills your nostrils and the sounds of insects and small
animals fill your ears as you move along the path.  

[ Exits: north south west ]
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A Lizardman is nearly invisible in the trees.

1633/2534 HP  108/3110 MP  2141/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2892119 | Close to a lake (NSW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* On the lakeshore
  Finally, you stand at the shore of a lake.  The water appears clean and
clear, and you can see birds out on the lake, diving and coming up with
silvery fish in their beaks.  The shore of the lake is covered with cattails
and small red and yellow flowers.  The mud here is very thick and you can
see prints which have sunk into the mud about five inches.  The air here is
very thick and humid, although the slight breeze off the water makes it feel
somewhat cooler than back on the path.  There is a large tree here, its
branches lower to the water than many you have seen in the marsh.  It
appears that the branches extend completely across the lake, overlapping
with branches from other trees.  There are splashes out on the water, and
you catch fleeting glimpses of bass and other fish leaping out to catch an
insect, before disappearing with barely a ripple on the surface of the lake.

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
A swarm of mosquitoes rises from the steamy marshlands to plague you.
(Golden Aura) A Marshling father scans the boundaries of the village.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A brutish Lizardman moves silently through the marsh.
A garter snake suns itself on a rock.

n
Out on the lake
  The water in the lake is lukewarm.  It probably never drops to any
temperature that would be uncomfortable for the average human.  The water is
clear, and you can clearly see fish swimming in the waters.  Also birds dive
and swim in the water with you.  Looking up, you see the tangle of limbs
high above you, making a bridge over the lake.  Algae grows on the rocks
near the lakeshore and on the rocks at the bottom of the lake.  There are
many aquatic plants in the lake as well, hiding some of the depths from
view.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A brilliantly blue feathered bird catches your eye.
(Golden Aura) An Elven hunter seems right at home in the trees.
(Translucent) (Red Aura) A bog wight moans as it remembers its lost life.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.
A garter snake suns itself on a rock.
A loon swims through the watery marshlands, diving for food.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
On the lake
  The waters here are crystal clear.  To the south, you see the far shore
and the tree, which is on the other end of the bridge.  The tree is much
like the one that grows on this side of the lake.  West is a thriving mass
of thick vegetation, and even here the insects which fly to and from the
reeds are a near constant cloud over the water.  Silver, black and brown
fish leap from the water to skillfully catch the insects, and a small frog
paddles by with its tongue flickering constantly as it devours more of the
insects.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]
(Hidden) A tree frog sits here singing melodiously.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.
A swarm of mosquitoes rises from the steamy marshlands to plague you.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) Lurking amongst the trees, a troll waits for something good to eat.
A cute little muskrat forages for food.
(Hidden) The alligator lies in wait for its prey.

On the lakeshore next to a great tree
  The lakeshore is fairly solid here, and the roots of an enormous tree
help to provide footing.  As you look around, you notice that the great tree
here stands almost alone, and is the tallest in this part of the marsh.  It
continues up high above the surrounding treetops, and its branches extend in
all directions.  Some of the southern branches extend far out over the lake,
and they seem to mingle with branches from another great tree on the other
side of the lake, creating a natural bridge across the lake.  You can
continue around the lake, or maybe take a swim in the inviting waters,
though you get the feeling that predators are always on the lookout for some
unwary thing in the deep waters.  You could also go over the bridge, if you
wish, or continue deeper into the marshlands to the north.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
A brilliantly blue feathered bird catches your eye.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) Lurking amongst the trees, a troll waits for something good to eat.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A brutish Lizardman moves silently through the marsh.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A brutish Lizardman moves silently through the marsh.

Cilmarill gossips 'Oblo I'm falling in love with you'

n
Steamy path
  After passing the great tree you come to a slight clearing in the
marshland.  Here the path is broad and the trees and undergrowth do not
intrude.  The mud steams and fills the air with misty clouds of vapor as the
mud bubbles, never seeming to dry at all.  The scent of stagnant water is
heavy and the oozing brown muck clings to everything it touches.  In the
distance, to the northwest, you can see the largest tree you have ever seen.
From here it is difficult to make out much detail, though its branches seem
to hang down like those of a weeping willow.  Also, you can finally
determine where the primal chanting is coming from.  It, too, is coming from
the northwest, and it would seem as if the tree shelters whatever, or
whoever is chanting.  A King Fisher glides overhead and a small squeaking
shriek comes from the undergrowth to the east, and you quickly glance around
for other paths.  It would appear that after crossing the lake you can only
go toward the large tree in the distance.  

[ Exits: north south ]
     Delicate with an enchanting fragrance, these flowers brighten up the marshlands.
A slender, white-feathered bird flies around, looking for food.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.
A giant frog searches hungrily for food.
A swarm of mosquitoes rises from the steamy marshlands to plague you.
(Golden Aura) A mother sits here, nursing a Marshling baby.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

>>    *[NOEXP]* WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2534/2534 HP  3110/3200 MP  2146/2101 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2883386 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

(Player) (Golden Aura) (Linkdead) Relek of the past!.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (Linkdead) EmJay the Shaman.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Lv 108  G 2883386 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Greenwart Swamp (2113)

By Agroth's marsh (2112)

The edge of a steamy marsh (G)
  As you turn off the swampy path, you realize that the loggers back in Aylor 
were not as drunk as they should have been from all the Firebreather they had
been drinking. Clearly visible, now that the loggers have chopped through the
undergrowth and the trees, is the trail you followed to see for yourself if 
the wild stories the loggers were telling were spun out of firebreather, or 
if a real adventure could be here. You stand at the very edge of the steaming
wetland, hearing the small chitterings, buzzings and splashes that are 
associated with places such as this; however, there is also a very faint 
chanting on the breeze that doesn't belong here. As you look around, you 
notice that like any marshland or wetland, this one is full of greenery, 
though there is a multitude of colors from flowers, insects, and decay mixed 
with the trees. As you continue to look, you notice three paths branching 
from this point, going deeper into the marsh, and of course, the way back to 
the swampy path.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A very large brown bear searches through the undergrowth for food.
A garter snake suns itself on a rock.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A brutish Lizardman moves silently through the marsh.
A marsh vole searches through dense vegetation for food.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2534/2534 HP  3095/3110 MP  2146/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2883386 | The edge of a steamy marsh (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
rfa dark and gloomy

 You have no recollection of any room with that name.

The sounds of bubbling mud and insects warn you of the renewal of the Marshlands.

e
A dark and gloomy path
  As you leave the sunlit clearing behind, you find yourself on a winding
path filled with tall trees, their trunks thick and their bark a greenish
brown and riddled with deep fissures.  High overhead, the branches of the
trees weave into a canopy which serves to block out the light.  Harsh calls
from some exotic birds, as well as soft whirrs and buzzings filter through
the thick undergrowth.  There are sounds of scrabbling and snuffling deep in
the undergrowth as well.  The ground here is muddy, but it seems drier than
the ground in the stump dotted clearing.  The air is very humid, and seems
to press down on you.  To the west is the clearing, while to the north, the
winding path continues to snake its way into the marshlands.  

[ Exits: north west ]
(Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) Shifting through the shadows, the bog imp waits to surprise an innocent
victim.
(Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) Shifting through the shadows, the bog imp waits to surprise an innocent
victim.

The edge of a steamy marsh (G)
  As you turn off the swampy path, you realize that the loggers back in Aylor 
were not as drunk as they should have been from all the Firebreather they had
been drinking. Clearly visible, now that the loggers have chopped through the
undergrowth and the trees, is the trail you followed to see for yourself if 
the wild stories the loggers were telling were spun out of firebreather, or 
if a real adventure could be here. You stand at the very edge of the steaming
wetland, hearing the small chitterings, buzzings and splashes that are 
associated with places such as this; however, there is also a very faint 
chanting on the breeze that doesn't belong here. As you look around, you 
notice that like any marshland or wetland, this one is full of greenery, 
though there is a multitude of colors from flowers, insects, and decay mixed 
with the trees. As you continue to look, you notice three paths branching 
from this point, going deeper into the marsh, and of course, the way back to 
the swampy path.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2534/2534 HP  3110/3110 MP  2145/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2883386 | The edge of a steamy marsh (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Along a narrow and shady path
  The shade here is somewhat cooling, though shafts of sunlight break
through the light covering of branches.  The scent of mud and rotting
vegetation fills the air and the sounds of insects, birds and some
rustlings, probably of smaller animals, fill the air.  The air here is still
and sound does not carry far in the close vegetation which helps to make the
path you are now following.  You glance toward the opening in the
vegetation, where the loggers chopped into the marshlands, and then toward
the darker path leading to the north.  

[ Exits: north east ]
(Golden Aura) An Elven hunter seems right at home in the trees.
(Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) Shifting through the shadows, the bog imp waits to surprise an innocent
victim.
(Hidden) A small wolf stalks the marshlands for prey.
The dragonfly zips around the marshlands.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2534/2534 HP  3110/3110 MP  2144/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2883386 | Along a narrow and shady path (NE)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
A darkening marshy path
  The mud here lacks the steam of that in the open air, but still sticky,
clinging to anything that touches it.  Deep prints show in the mud, from
creatures that have traveled this way.  The trees along the path are tall
and have thick trunks.  Their branches reach high above the path and become
a maze of interconnecting branches.  Thick vegetation fills the spaces
between the brown and gnarled trunks, and moss grows in streamers from the
branches far above.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A beautifully feathered duck is at home in the marshlands.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) Lurking amongst the trees, a troll waits for something good to eat.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2534/2534 HP  3110/3110 MP  2140/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2883386 | A dark and gloomy path (NW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* A dark and winding path
  The path continues to snake through the tall trees.  Here and there,
thick tangles of roots snake across the path; a danger to any unwary
traveler.  The air is close and steamy and the sounds of life surround you
here.  There are soft sucking and bubbling sounds from somewhere to the
north and east, and the scents of rotting vegetation and wet earth fill your
nostrils.  The path continues to wind both south and east.  

[ Exits: east south ]
(Red Aura) An enormous mud-colored giant crashes through the marshlands.
A medium sized turtle makes its home in the marshes.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2534/2534 HP  3110/3110 MP  2139/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2883386 | A dark and winding path (ES)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
Deeper into the marshlands
  Here the path opens up a bit, and becomes broader.  The sun hammers down
on this spot as well, and you can see fallen trees to either side of the
path.  A few saplings reach toward the sky, but they are only a few feet
high at the moment.  Large, rotted logs litter the undergrowth, and farther
back in the undergrowth, where the larger trees again reclaim the land, you
can see glowing green fungus and moss spreading over the decaying
vegetation.  The path becomes very muddy here, and a small pool of stagnant
water to the east bubbles and steams.  Small reptiles and swarms of insects
move around the water and across the path.  A small rodent chitters and
scurries across the path, disappearing into the undergrowth.  The air
becomes heaver with water, and you can smell the sickeningly sweet smell of
decay and the slightly sharp odor of water and mud.  

[ Exits: north west ]
A cute little muskrat forages for food.
A crane fly buzzes around, annoying you.
A cute little muskrat forages for food.
A crane fly buzzes around, annoying you.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A brutish Lizardman moves silently through the marsh.
A cute little muskrat forages for food.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A Lizardman is nearly invisible in the trees.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2534/2534 HP  3110/3110 MP  2138/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2883386 | Deeper into the marshlands (NW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Dark winding path
  The trees grow thickly along this stretch of the winding path.  Ancient
sentinels guarding the secrets of the deeper and darker places in the marsh.
Thick bushes with thorns and bright flowers choke the sides of the path and
the sweet smell of nectar permeates the air.  Life, it seems, is everywhere,
the cycle shown in so many ways, rotting logs, fungi feeding on dead things
back in the dark.  The death screams of small rodents to some predator.  All
these things you can hear and sometimes even see while traveling through the
marshland.  The sounds, sights and smells are all of life, death and
rebirth.  You can hear more clearly, as well, a source of water, larger than
the small stagnant pools which form in the underbrush from the constant
dripping of water from the trees and vines.  An errant breeze lightly
brushes your cheek, and it brings with it the chanting you heard when first
entering the marshlands, and you again wonder what the source of that sound
could be as it tugs at something deep inside you; something primal and
almost forgotten, yet still very real and very much a part of your being.  

[ Exits: east south ]
A garter snake suns itself on a rock.
(Golden Aura) A diva wanders the marshlands, tending the plantlife with a gentle skill.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) An ogre shambles through the marsh.
(Hidden) A tree frog sits here singing melodiously.
A marsh vole searches through dense vegetation for food.
A crane fly buzzes around, annoying you.

The edge of a steamy marsh (G)
  As you turn off the swampy path, you realize that the loggers back in Aylor 
were not as drunk as they should have been from all the Firebreather they had
been drinking. Clearly visible, now that the loggers have chopped through the
undergrowth and the trees, is the trail you followed to see for yourself if 
the wild stories the loggers were telling were spun out of firebreather, or 
if a real adventure could be here. You stand at the very edge of the steaming
wetland, hearing the small chitterings, buzzings and splashes that are 
associated with places such as this; however, there is also a very faint 
chanting on the breeze that doesn't belong here. As you look around, you 
notice that like any marshland or wetland, this one is full of greenery, 
though there is a multitude of colors from flowers, insects, and decay mixed 
with the trees. As you continue to look, you notice three paths branching 
from this point, going deeper into the marsh, and of course, the way back to 
the swampy path.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

A very large brown bear searches through the undergrowth for food.
A garter snake suns itself on a rock.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A brutish Lizardman moves silently through the marsh.
A marsh vole searches through dense vegetation for food.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Rock Garden
  An austere rock garden extends in every direction beneath an ashen sky. 
Intended once as a zone of pure contemplation, the garden is now animated by
an odd assortment of rock creatures.  Enigmatic stones catch your eye.

Rock Garden (G)
  An austere rock garden extends in every direction beneath an ashen sky. 
Intended once as a zone of pure contemplation, the garden is now animated by
an odd assortment of rock creatures.  Enigmatic stones catch your eye.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A strange pink rock sits here.

pet rock

------------------------------------------------------------
The little rock growls with delight and you feel yourself transported into a realm of rock.
------------------------------------------------------------
Rock Out! (G) [**> PK <**]
  Layers and layers of dense primordial drumming saturate you as you find
yourself in a realm of pure vibration.  A single balloon floats here.  

[ Exits: none ]
     (Invis) (Magic) A deadly plume of gas spirals here.
     (Magic) (Cursed) A cynical yet sentimental song adheres to those who sing it.
A vigilant gas demon awaits transgressors.
A vigilant gas demon awaits transgressors.
Bob the Blob is searching for direction.

Rock Garden (G)
  An austere rock garden extends in every direction beneath an ashen sky. 
Intended once as a zone of pure contemplation, the garden is now animated by
an odd assortment of rock creatures.  Enigmatic stones catch your eye.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A cute little rock wags its tail at you.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) YeeShin NecOccisor.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Lexicon the Navigator.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Garence the pranciest prancin prancer..
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

  -  [dual]    Dual wielded weapon to use               'holy might'
  -  [held]    Held item to return after using portals  lasso
  -  [spellup] Spellup to use                           napalm;spellup
  -  [hpot]    Health potion to use                     breakfast
  -  [mpot]    Mana potion to use                       moonlight
  -  [vpot]    Moves potion to use                      refreshing
  -  [pbag]    Potions bag                              backpack
  -  [bag]     General bag                              backpack
  -  [attack1] Primary attack                           ca force
  -  [attack2] Secondary attack                         ca vamp
  -  [debuff1] First debuff                             ca poison
  -  [debuff2] Second debuff                            ca wither
  -  [cplvl]   Level to CP level until                  150
  -  [cpexp]   CP Level noexp toggle amount             700
  -  [group]   Group Frame Format until                 1
  -  [tdiff]   Time Difference from Mud Time            7
  -  [speak]   Speak audio alerts                       false

Lv 108  G 2998334 | Forest path (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Dark Tunnel
  You stand in a dark tunnel.   Your light source illuminates a cleanly cut
tunnel.  You seem to be standing where it ends. On the wall you see
scribbled in blood:

Progress only if thou canst not be seen or if thou art powerful. 

The air is dry but cold.  The floor is even without any marks of tools.  The
walls are straight without any indication that mining tools have carved this
tunnel, only to the north are there any marks at all. 

The tunnel plunges into darkness to the south.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.

nails.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

 protecting the vile cultists, go now, and put an end to their evil

e
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2225/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

w
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2223/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | Mudpits (EWD)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

(Player) (Golden Aura) Garence the pranciest prancin prancer..

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2224/2226 mv  646tnl

n
Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

[ Exits: north east ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2223/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | Courtyard (NE)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

n
Voting Room (G)
  Here people come to vote. Even in the army, the most
undemoctratic thing in the world, people vote. Not 
all votes here are binding, but there is a time and
a place for everything.

Plastered on the walls are some reminders of what boot 
camp stands for:

Theme:
Boot Camp is, in essence, a clan made up of new players. Based
on the idea of helping the Helpershelper, this clan will take in new
players and let them learn until they decide to become teachers or
are ready to move on to bigger and better things.

Clan Decisions:
All decisions in the clan are made through voting by 
the Clan Leaders and rank 5 or 6 players. Although the 
clan will be primarily democratic, Clan Leaders or the 
Helpershelper have final say and can overrule any votes 
if they feel they go against the Clan's Petition, Theme,
Safety, or Harmony.

While the original clan petition and modified form 
remains on the Website under the watchful eye of
the Clan's Web handler, these two things remain
unchanged, at least until another vote is cast...

[ Exits: south (down) ]
     [*] A generic voting booth is here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Dusty Road
  You step out from the light forest behind you and onto a dusty road. All 
before you the growth has stopped abruptly. Not only does it appear someone 
has clear-cut any sign of flora, but there is also a massive pit in the 
ground. It looks as if the pit has been cut straight down with only a narrow 
zigzagging path leading to its depths. Before the pit, however, is a small 
camp made up of roughshod tents and white stone buildings. It looks as if a 
decent wind would carry this camp away, over the cliff, and into the pit.
Every sound seems to echo off of the walls of the pit, making it impossible 
to determine their origin. Barking voices can be heard above the din of metal
on stone in the distance.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) Dizzily racing around, a playful gnoll pup chases its tail.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3030/3060 MP  2202/2226 mv  646tnl
