s
A Dusty Road
  The gravel crunches under your feet as you continue down the dirt road. The 
crushed rock is all of a consistent size, suggesting the rubble was created 
for this specific purpose. Farther up the road, the side of a white stone 
house can be seen to the west, sidled by three tattered tents. The tent 
farthest to the east is the largest, with a strange sign hanging outside of 
it. The remnants of a fence are the only thing separating the path north and 
the crossroads to the south. The barks from the south are starting to compete
with the clash of metal on stone within the pit.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) Dizzily racing around, a playful gnoll pup chases its tail.
(Golden Aura) Dizzily racing around, a playful gnoll pup chases its tail.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2226/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | A Dusty Road (NS)
s
>>    
A Dusty Crossroads
  The noise here is unbearable. The screaming of stone being hewn by picks and 
hammers, the screech of metal carts against rusted rails, and the constant 
barking all combine into an intolerable cacophony. Tattered burlap tents open
to the south and east, each one emitting more barks. The tent to the east is 
quite a bit larger than the one to the south. A sign can be seen above the 
tent to the south. To the west leads a path down into the pit. You can also 
see the front door to the white building. Unlike the two closest tents, a 
third tent stands atop some rubble to the west. This tent is smaller than the
other two, but is much less tattered and has been erected strong enough to 
keep out any debris that may fly in with the breeze.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A large rat mindlessly nibbles on something. [QUEST]
(Red Aura) A gnoll soldier is here, barking at the slaves.
(Red Aura) A gnoll soldier is here, barking at the slaves.
(Red Aura) A gnoll pup barks loudly at you!
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) Clearly not from the quarry, this eldar seems very uncomfortable.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2226/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | A Dusty Crossroads (NESW)
w
>>    
Entrance to the Quarry
  As you get closer to the pit, the rumble of mining carts, hammers, and 
chisels overwhelms any other noise from the camp. Although less deafening 
than the barking of the gnolls, the sounds coming from the pit also comes 
with vibrations. The rubble path turns more solid as you approach the descent
into the pit to the west. Looking over the edge of the pit you can see the 
narrow path leading downward at a dizzying incline. The door to the stone 
building faces south, and has clearly been repaired multiple times. Barking 
comes from both north and south of the road. From each direction, the barking
sounds drastically different. The staccato barking from the tent to the south
is monotonous and abrupt, while the rhythmic barking from the north varies in
pitch and tone.

[ Exits: north east south down ]
A large rat mindlessly nibbles on something. [QUEST]
(Red Aura) A gnoll pup barks loudly at you!

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2226/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | Entrance to the Quarry (NESD)
n
>>    
Overseer's Home
  This was the last standing building from whatever happened before the gnolls.
Based off of rubble piled up in the corner of this two-room building, it was 
once nicely furnished and lavishly decorated. All the remains are the shards 
of painted ceramics and shredded strips of fabric, presumably paintings. All 
that remains is the hearth in the middle of the room, a table near the north 
wall, and a ruined doorway to the west. Despite the rubble, the building is 
well maintained; any damage once sustained has been repaired using the bounty
from the quarry. There is a faint smell of bread baking, but none can be 
found.

[ Exits: south ]
(Red Aura) Aarrssa the wife of Grak'ou stands here.
(Red Aura) A withered old gnoll sits by the hearth, slowly grooming himself.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2225/2226 mv  646tnl

Lv 108  G 2963609 | A Dusty Crossroads (NESW)
e
>>    Dormitory
  This tent is the largest tent out of all of them. This north section of the 
gnolls dormitory hasn't housed any soldiers in a long time. Empty cots and 
bunk beds are scattered about by the dozens. There is no telling how many
gnolls this camp once held. The tent continues to the south, where it appears
the remaining soldiers turned slavers have been spending their time when 
they're not on duty. Angry slaver guards greet you as you enter their tent,
ready to impede your progress deeper into their tent.

[ Exits: east south west ]
(Red Aura) A gnoll soldier is here, barking at the slaves.
(Red Aura) Resting comfortably, a weary gnoll guard daydreams of raiding and pillaging.
(Red Aura) Resting comfortably, a weary gnoll guard daydreams of raiding and pillaging.
(Red Aura) A gnoll slaver eyes you suspiciously as you enter the tent.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2224/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | Dormitory (ESW)
>>    Dormitory
  This room within the large tent is noticeably dilapidated. All of the cots 
are uneven, sloping, and in a general state of disrepair. Without any 
decorations, the walls of the tent have a peculiar look. Dust blows in from 
under the walls, where stakes were lazily hammered into the soft ground.
Dwarves are strewn about like small snoring corpses. Every few minutes, 
another dwarf is dragged out by a gnoll from his "comfortable"
slumber to work yet another shift in the quarry.

[ Exits: west ]
(Red Aura) A gnoll soldier is here, barking at the slaves.
(Golden Aura) A dwarf sits on the floor eating.
(Golden Aura) Resting in a cot, a dwarven slave is trying to fall asleep.

Lv 108  G 2963609 | Dormitory (ESW)
>>    Dormitory
  This large tent continues, full of bunk beds and small tables. The tables do 
not offer any chairs, but tall stools instead. Lewd pictures of gnolls in 
compromising positions and interesting poses line the walls of the tent. The
gnolls must have thought no one other than themselves would have made it this
far into their tents. Playing cards, plates, and goblets litter every corner 
of this section of the tent. Gnolls are just as prevalent as the litter that 
clutters this area.

Lv 108  G 2963609 | A Dusty Crossroads (NESW)
>>    Infirmary
  As you enter the tent, the first thing you notice is the noise. The din of 
quarry life seems to have been left outside, while a new symphony of 
unpleasant sounds greets you within. The sheer number of cots suggests this 
camp once housed many more than are presently stationed. Cots are lined along
the east and west walls, with injured gnolls on the west being tended and 
dwarves on the east. The severity and amount of dwarves suggests they have 
been receiving less than adequate care from their slavers. Herbs, tinctures,
and labeled potions are strewn about a table on the south end of the tent.

[ Exits: north ]
     A row of dirty cots fills up most of the infirmary.
(Golden Aura) A wounded dwarf is moaning in pain.
(Golden Aura) A wounded dwarf is moaning in pain.
(Red Aura) Whimpering softly, a wounded gnoll soldier is resting on a cot.
(Red Aura) A gnoll medic is here offering triage to the wounded.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2224/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | Entrance to the Quarry (NESD)
>>    Overseer's Office
  Of the three tents, this is the most impressive. It is not the largest, but 
it is the most sturdy. Support beams have been sewn into the corners and top 
of the tent, to increase its stability. As if by some magical force, the 
noise from outside is completely absent here. The tan dye of the tent has 
faded, except in squares along each of the walls. Samples of stone, papers, 
and various implements of torture can be found atop a large wooden desk in 
the center of the tent. In spite of convention, there are no chairs in this 
tent.

[ Exits: north ]
     A large wooden desk sits here piled with papers.
(Red Aura) Growling in frustration, the gnoll Overseer barely notices your intrusion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2223/2226 mv  646tnl  
Lv 108  G 2963609 | Overseer's Office (N)
>>

Entrance to the Quarry (2223)

A Dusty Crossroads
  The noise here is unbearable. The screaming of stone being hewn by picks and 
hammers, the screech of metal carts against rusted rails, and the constant 
barking all combine into an intolerable cacophony. Tattered burlap tents open
to the south and east, each one emitting more barks. The tent to the east is 
quite a bit larger than the one to the south. A sign can be seen above the 
tent to the south. To the west leads a path down into the pit. You can also 
see the front door to the white building. Unlike the two closest tents, a 
third tent stands atop some rubble to the west. This tent is smaller than the
other two, but is much less tattered and has been erected strong enough to 
keep out any debris that may fly in with the breeze.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Ascension Bluff (2181)

A Somber Walkway (G)
  After ascending a stairway of clouds leading into the heavens, an individual 
would probably expect to find something surreal at the top. Many an explorer 
has been left disappointed, however, since this is nothing more than the 
Ascension Bluff Nursing Home. The architect thought that a stairway of clouds
would make the residents feel closer to the gods. Unfortunately, all this 
served to do was make this location less suitable for visitors and employees 
to frequent. Further to this, when one closely inspects the clouds, they will
come to the realization that they are not real clouds at all, but rather 
millions of tiny cotton balls affixed to a steel frame. Interestingly enough,
it seems that a nursing home in the clouds acquires quite the eclectic bunch 
of residents. Anyone who chances by a for a visit will find that this nursing
home contains more than just your ordinary sampling of senior citizens.

[ Exits: north down ]

(Red Aura) A death coach stands here, terrifyingly silent and still.
(Red Aura) A little owl is resting on its perch.

A Somber Walkway (2226)

A Somber Walkway (2226)

Entrance to Ascension Bluff
  At the entrance to the Ascension Bluff Nursing home the pathway widens into a
semi-circle of flagstones that are surrounded by several stout wooden 
benches. A low-set stone wall hugs all of these particulars, and three wide, 
curved steps lead up to the front entrance of the nursing home. This nursing 
home has been made to look like a lodge in hopes that the residents will feel
like they are simply here on vacation. The roof has a steep slope and the 
exterior of the building has been carefully crafted from wooden logs. Patio 
doors lead straight out to the front gardens and walkway from many locations 
along the front of the building. Even more light is brought into the nursing 
home via expansive, arched windows that take up much of the wall-space above
the patio doors.

[ Exits: (north) south ]
     (Magic) A stout wooden bench is here to relax on.
(Red Aura) This carnivorous plant is ready to chomp some flesh!
(Red Aura) A death coach stands here, terrifyingly silent and still.
(Red Aura) A little owl is resting on its perch.

Staff Hallway
  This section of the hallway has a resident's room leading off to either side.
It is clear at this point that the door at the end of the hall leads to the 
staff room since the large sign indicating it as such is visible from here.
There is a large painting hung on each side of the hallway and someone has 
hung several seashell wind chimes from the roof. Since these chimes really 
don't fit in with the overall decor, speculation that one of the residents 
hung these up would probably prove correct upon further investigation.

Staff Hallway
  This section of the hallway ends at the staff room. Here there are two large 
potted trees sitting in each corner of the hall. The hallway leads south 
toward the front entrance of the building. A painting of a beach has been 
hung on the wall over top of a bench that sits adjacent to the wall. The 
hallway floor is made of durable hardwood and has such a shine to it that it 
looks practically brand new. The janitor of this facility must take good care
of the floors here.

[ Exits: (north) (east) south (west) ]
     (Magic) A paisley bench waits here to rest tired legs.

(Golden Aura) This mouse is gathering materials for its nest.

The Lounge (2226)

The Conservatory
  Being in this conservatory is like stepping into a tropical garden that is 
brimming with beautiful plants. The conservatory's structure is composed of 
glass and steel, and is roughly rectangular in format. At its central point 
the roof comes to a fifty foot high apex. That means the trees here sure can 
grow tall! The climate is carefully controlled to be hot and excessively 
humid. Vivid, picturesque, peaceful, and uplifting, this conservatory is a 
welcome retreat for anyone who seeks some solace.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

The Conservatory (2216)

The Conservatory
  This portion of the conservatory features a pond that contains tropical water
lilies. These lilies are huge, their blossoms span more than a foot across.
There are red, pink, and white blossoms and their smell is spectacular.
Around the pond grow trees draped in orchids. Exotic and curious, tropical 
pitcher plants also grow here. The pitcher plants are definitely one of the 
top conversation topics in the nursing home.

[ Exits: (north) south west ]

A rabbit foot fern thrives as it grows here in its hanging basket.

The Conservatory
  This section of the conservatory has a small bench to sit on in order to 
enjoy watching the waterfall to the north. Bright blue and purple butterflies
flutter through the air here and are quite beautiful to watch. There is a 
hardwood walkway and the trees that grow along it reach up tall, nearly to 
the roof.

The Conservatory (2222)

A confounding cockroach falls onto your head! Yuck!
The Conservatory
  The jungle-like environment of the conservatory is a flourishing green canopy
that inundates the nose with fresh scents from trees and flowers. The air is 
humid and warm and the floor is made from hardwood, crafted in just such a 
way to give the feeling of walking along a long zigzagging bridge in the 
midst of a jungle. The plants here come from tropical rainforests or tropical
grasslands, and are often ornate and colorful.

[ Exits: (north) east south ]

The Conservatory (2220)

The Conservatory
  This section of the conservatory is much like the last. There are many tall 
trees of several different varieties. The sun shines in through the glass 
roof and beams down warmly upon the plants and anyone standing in its way.
The air smells sweet and is heavy with moisture. The distant sound of a 
waterfall can be heard, but aside from that there is a serene silence about 
this place. A stylized statue of a gargoyle peers out from the southwest 
corner of the room, and bright flowers decorate the space around it.

[ Exits: north east (south) ]
     (Invis) (Magic) The jester mask is very vibrant in color.

The Conservatory (2218)

The Conservatory
  This section of the conservatory has been designed to have a rock face take 
up the wall on its eastern side. A modest waterfall gently trickles down this
great wall of rock. Several varieties of ferns are growing through the rocks 
of this wall as well, creating a beautifully tranquil scene. The walkway here
forms a bit of a bridge and the waterfall's water mysteriously disappears 
underneath it, presumably to enter the nursing home's plumbing system in 
order to be recycled.

[ Exits: north south west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) Someone's poor little toy goat has been abandoned here.

(Red Aura) This flower is emitting an uninviting aroma.

w
The Conservatory
  This section of the conservatory has been designed to have a rock face take 
up the wall on its eastern side. A modest waterfall gently trickles down this
great wall of rock. Several varieties of ferns are growing through the rocks 
of this wall as well, creating a beautifully tranquil scene. The walkway here
forms a bit of a bridge and the waterfall's water mysteriously disappears 
underneath it, presumably to enter the nursing home's plumbing system in 
order to be recycled.

[ Exits: north south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 800/2494 HP  1159/3060 MP  2225/2226 mv  230tnl  
Lv 108  G 2984563 | The Conservatory (NSW)
w
>>    The Conservatory
  Being in this conservatory is like stepping into a tropical garden that is 
brimming with beautiful plants. The conservatory's structure is composed of 
glass and steel, and is roughly rectangular in format. At its central point 
the roof comes to a fifty foot high apex. That means the trees here sure can 
grow tall! The climate is carefully controlled to be hot and excessively 
humid. Vivid, picturesque, peaceful, and uplifting, this conservatory is a 
welcome retreat for anyone who seeks some solace.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

  The center of the lounge is furnished with several small tables which are

from the ceiling here. The floor has been beautified with hardwood and four 
strong white pillars carry the weight of the ceiling upon themselves. To the

The Lounge (2225)

A Sanitary Hallway (2224)

An obtuse fly buzzes right into your face!
The Reception Area (2224)

The Reception Area
  The architectural team for this nursing home pondered the fact that in the 
beginning, these types of facilities started out as extensions to hospitals.
Therefore, to a certain extent, folks expect that a nursing home will retain 
that appearance. The team also recognized that the building's entrance is 
incredibly important in giving visitors that positive first impression of 
what the overall facility will be like. So the designer team worked hard to 
create a spacious, colorful, and inviting entrance. They wanted to imbue an 
overwhelming feeling of happiness within the individual as they took their 
first steps into the building. To do this, they utilized a palette of warm 
color tones for several large wall murals, as well as floors crafted with a 
tile mosaic finish. They added comfortable furniture to relax in, and spared 
no expense on an extravagant, cathedral ceiling, made perfect with the 
addition of incredible skylights.

[ Exits: north east (south) west ]
     This small sign is discreet, yet impossible to miss.
     Brightly colored armchairs have been scattered throughout this area.
This doctor must have woken up on the wrong side of the bed.
This unoccupied wheelchair is propelled by some unknowable force.
Some uneaten porridge is starting to give off an offensive odor.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2223/2226 mv  230tnl

[*Daily Blessing*] 2494/2494 HP  3060/3060 MP  2223/2226 mv  230tnl  
Lv 108  G 2984563 | The Reception Area (NESW)
>>    Entrance to Ascension Bluff (2222)

A Somber Walkway
  The ground here has been built upon a study steel wire framework. It is so 
sturdy, in fact, that an individual is led to believe that they are walking 
on terra firma rather than treading 3000 feet up in the sky. This entire 
walkway has been carefully crafted into a beautiful courtyard that leads 
right up to the front doors of the nursing home. Dogwoods in a constant state
of bloom have been planted all along the walkway, their white blossoms intent
on mimicking the idea of clouds. White rose bushes were added to fill in gaps
between the trees, and the ground aside of the walkway is covered in actual 
growing cotton. Little bits of fluff float around in the air and tempt the 
formulation of a sneeze.

[ Exits: north south ]
This carnivorous plant is ready to chomp some flesh!
This carnivorous plant is ready to chomp some flesh!

Entrance to Ascension Bluff
  At the entrance to the Ascension Bluff Nursing home the pathway widens into a
semi-circle of flagstones that are surrounded by several stout wooden 
benches. A low-set stone wall hugs all of these particulars, and three wide, 
curved steps lead up to the front entrance of the nursing home. This nursing 
home has been made to look like a lodge in hopes that the residents will feel
like they are simply here on vacation. The roof has a steep slope and the 
exterior of the building has been carefully crafted from wooden logs. Patio 
doors lead straight out to the front gardens and walkway from many locations 
along the front of the building. Even more light is brought into the nursing 
home via expansive, arched windows that take up much of the wall-space above
the patio doors.

[ Exits: north south ]
     A stout wooden bench is here to relax on.
A death coach stands here, terrifyingly silent and still.
A little owl is resting on its perch.
A little owl is resting on its perch.

The Activity Room
  The walls of the activity room are completely painted into a mural that is 
one scene which goes all the way around the room. It shows the silhouettes of
trees as they bask in a brilliantly colored sunset. Around the walls of the 
room, wooden tables have been set up, with several wooden chairs having been 
pushed up to each. The tables are littered with miscellaneous bits of 
unfinished pottery, watercolor paintings, and quilts. A rocking chair sits in
an unoccupied space closest to the door, and the rest of the space is filled 
with cabinetry and a couple of kilns.

The Lounge (2244)

The Sunroom
  Since sunlight helps to alleviate certain types of mental illness, such as 
depression, the designers of this nursing home decided they would like to 
create a room that would let in the maximum amount of sun possible. All of 
the windows in this sunroom are made up of small panes of glass that have 
been separated by wood trim. The windows are fixed in place, since wherever 
they have been built, they take up the whole wall-space. The walls are 
nothing more than a frame to help support the windows, and then these windows
arc right into the roof. The floor here is made of hardwood that continues in
from the lounge to the east. A number of pieces of classic furniture have 
been proudly displayed in this room, almost too precious-looking to even sit 
on!

[ Exits: east ]
     A soothing fountain flows here.
Here is a courier who looks a bit stressed.
A sunray is beautifying the room.

The Lounge
  A bright white kitchen has been set up here for use by the residents. The 
ability for them to cook their own meals is one that makes them feel more 
comfortable in the nursing home. This kitchen is especially nice, because it 
has a few special features. The refrigeration device here magically refills 
itself whenever a food item is taken out of it, there is a wood burning stove
that magically replenishes its stock of wood, and there is a really advanced 
plumbing system that advances nothing less than the most pure water from 
gleaming metal taps at several different sink stations.

     (Magic) A vitamin was lost here.
     (Magic) (Hum) A small blue pill was discarded here.

  Since sunlight helps to alleviate certain types of mental illness, such as 
depression, the designers of this nursing home decided they would like to 
create a room that would let in the maximum amount of sun possible. All of 
the windows in this sunroom are made up of small panes of glass that have 
been separated by wood trim. The windows are fixed in place, since wherever 
they have been built, they take up the whole wall-space. The walls are 
nothing more than a frame to help support the windows, and then these windows
arc right into the roof. The floor here is made of hardwood that continues in
from the lounge to the east. A number of pieces of classic furniture have 
been proudly displayed in this room, almost too precious-looking to even sit 
on!

[ Exits: east ]
     (Magic) A soothing fountain flows here.
(Golden Aura) Here is a courier who looks a bit stressed.
(Golden Aura) A sunray is beautifying the room.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Athlau the Alpha.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

(Player) (Golden Aura) Qpak the Blacksmith.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Elven Fruit Orchards (2222)

A Dusty Road
  You step out from the light forest behind you and onto a dusty road. All 
before you the growth has stopped abruptly. Not only does it appear someone 
has clear-cut any sign of flora, but there is also a massive pit in the 
ground. It looks as if the pit has been cut straight down with only a narrow 
zigzagging path leading to its depths. Before the pit, however, is a small 
camp made up of roughshod tents and white stone buildings. It looks as if a 
decent wind would carry this camp away, over the cliff, and into the pit.
Every sound seems to echo off of the walls of the pit, making it impossible 
to determine their origin. Barking voices can be heard above the din of metal
on stone in the distance.

A Dusty Road (2245)

A Dusty Crossroads
  The noise here is unbearable. The screaming of stone being hewn by picks and 
hammers, the screech of metal carts against rusted rails, and the constant 
barking all combine into an intolerable cacophony. Tattered burlap tents open
to the south and east, each one emitting more barks. The tent to the east is 
quite a bit larger than the one to the south. A sign can be seen above the 
tent to the south. To the west leads a path down into the pit. You can also 
see the front door to the white building. Unlike the two closest tents, a 
third tent stands atop some rubble to the west. This tent is smaller than the
other two, but is much less tattered and has been erected strong enough to 
keep out any debris that may fly in with the breeze.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

[ Exits: north east ]

Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

w
>>    Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Cardo Maximus
  As you enter the city gates, you notice some of the beauty and luxury
Pompeii offers.  Under your feet, the street is paved with smooth limestone,
and elaborately constructed buildings are all around.  To the west, you see
a sign on a door.  To the north, the city waits to be explored.  Bronze
oil lanterns in each doorway light the street and allow the spectacular
murals on the walls to be seen.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

>>    Entrance to The Dungeon (G)
  A small stairway stands before you.  Screams of the tortured souls ring
out from the eerie stairway.  You ponder if you should go down or not,
wondering if the screams you hear are the souls of dead adventurers that had
intruded.  As you stand pondering, a wind blows by and sends a deep chill
down your spine; you are momentarily paralyzed, but quickly recover.  You
sense something sinister in this evil place, but you aren't sure exactly
what.  To the west, loud clanks and pounding noises ring out from a small
building.  And to the east is a quiet, medium-sized hut.

Stairway to the Dungeon
  Being careful not to trip, you slowly proceed down this stairway.  You
are hit immediately by the rancid smell of decay and wonder if you should
turn back as you run into a sticky spider's web.  Startled, you jump back as
a rat runs over your feet.  Your will seems to falter as you hear unhumanly
moans from farther down.  Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and
charge downward towards the noise, unprepared for what lies ahead.

>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Statue of Zeus at Olympus (G) (2199)

The Statue of Zeus
  On his head is a sculpted wreath of olive sprays, in his right hand he
holds a figure of Victory made from ivory and gold...  In his left hand, he
holds a sceptre inlaid with every kind of metal, with an eagle perched on
the sceptre.  His sandals are made of gold, as is his robe.  His garments
are carved with the animals and with lilies.  The throne is decorated with
gold, precious stones, ebony, and ivory.

>>    *[NOEXP]* WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Temple of the Dark God [**> PK <**]
  As you walk through the double doors into the temple, the first thing
you notice is the remarkable difference from what you expected. Judging
simply by the outer appearence, you would have said that this place could
have been any sort of office building for the government. But with its
oriental tapestries on the walls and lovely arabic rugs covering the floors,
you think it could be anything *except* an office building.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The edge of a steamy marsh (G)
  As you turn off the swampy path, you realize that the loggers back in Aylor 
were not as drunk as they should have been from all the Firebreather they had
been drinking. Clearly visible, now that the loggers have chopped through the
undergrowth and the trees, is the trail you followed to see for yourself if 
the wild stories the loggers were telling were spun out of firebreather, or 
if a real adventure could be here. You stand at the very edge of the steaming
wetland, hearing the small chitterings, buzzings and splashes that are 
associated with places such as this; however, there is also a very faint 
chanting on the breeze that doesn't belong here. As you look around, you 
notice that like any marshland or wetland, this one is full of greenery, 
though there is a multitude of colors from flowers, insects, and decay mixed 
with the trees. As you continue to look, you notice three paths branching 
from this point, going deeper into the marsh, and of course, the way back to 
the swampy path.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A very large brown bear searches through the undergrowth for food.
(Hidden) (White Aura) A human stalks the marshlands, hunting food.
(Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) Shifting through the shadows, the bog imp waits to surprise an innocent
victim.

n
n
A muddy path
  The path you are following is a sign of things to come it would seem. 
The trees here are tall, their large roots poking through the brown mud that
serves as a path.  The sounds of insects and chittering animals begins to
surround you as you move deeper into the marsh, and the heat mixed with
water vapor makes the air shimmer.  There is a light breeze, but it is by no
means a cooling one.  Through the trees to the left and right you can barely
make out dark, shady-looking pools of water.  The sound of frogs and other
aquatic animals drift to your ears.  Still the chanting continues, you
remember the loggers mentioning the chanting as well, and they also
mentioned dangers; fierce tribal lizardmen, and something about large rats
and moving trees.  Ahead the path continues deeper into the steamy quagmire,
though you can still return to the edge of this untamed land and try another
path or simply leave before you find those lizardmen.  

[ Exits: north south ]
     Delicate with an enchanting fragrance, these flowers brighten up the marshlands.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A Lizardman is nearly invisible in the trees.
(Golden Aura) An Elven hunter seems right at home in the trees.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.
(Hidden) A tree frog sits here singing melodiously.
Exhausted, Golothian, the giant woodsman, waits for the marshlands to claim him.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1529/2520 HP  2543/3183 MP  2199/2200 mv  687tnl  
Lv 109  G 3027990 | A muddy path (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Through dense vegetation
  The vegetation here has grown up over what little path there was in this
swamp.  Thick brown tree trunks block both east and west travel, and vines
with brightly colored flowers cover the path, along with several other
plants.  Moss grows all over everything here, and fungi of all sorts seem to
spring out of every crevice and crack in the bark of the trees and vines. 
It is extremely dark here, and the air is heavy with humidity and the scents
of flourishing undergrowth.  Ahead it looks as if this vegetation will
recede again and let in light.

e
Opening in the undergrowth
  Here the undergrowth is less than to the south, the path slopes up
slightly, and the mud is a little drier than in the surrounding area.  From
here you can see a bit farther in all directions.  To the north, and
slightly east, you can see the sparkling of sunlight on water, though only
brief glimpses of the body of water through the many trees that surround it.
There appears to be some form of rock formation directly north, though it is
covered in moss and plant life.  To the west, you see some sort of thorny
plant with long spines, and it does not look possible to penetrate the
undergrowth in that direction, even if you did wish to risk your skin on
those spines.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1529/2520 HP  2543/3183 MP  2197/2200 mv  687tnl  
Lv 109  G 3027990 | Opening in the undergrowth (ES)
>>    *[NOEXP]* On a well used path
  As you walk along this path, you notice faint signs of tracks.  Also
there are some discarded tools lying in the mud off to one side of the
trail.  It strikes you suddenly that this is the first time you can truly
call any cleared path in this marsh a trail.  There are still tall, thick
trees with vines and flowers growing around them, and the trail is still
dotted with shallow dips where water has collected, but it has been cleared
of most of the vegetation that thrives in the steamy climate.  To the east,
thick undergrowth and vines block any passage, except perhaps by the small
animals who call the marshlands home, while west will take you back to the
slight rise in the land.  North you can now plainly see the large lake,
though it is still a ways off.  The mound you first noticed on your way
along the path rises to the west and just to the north.  There is a faint
sound of rustling and hissing coming from farther to the north.  

[ Exits: north west ]

n
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Close to a lake
  From here you can see the lake more clearly than before.  Thick
vegetation is all around, but you notice that the trees on the lakeshore are
not growing quite so close together.  West from here the mound has an
opening, and appears to be a den of some sort.  The hissing and rustling you
heard is coming from inside the mound, and there are a lot of tracks leading
in and out of the opening.  There are still trees to the east and it appears
that one or two are dead, there are a couple of logs on the ground, covered
in fungi and moss which glows a soft green.  The scent of mud, decaying
vegetation and water fills your nostrils and the sounds of insects and small
animals fill your ears as you move along the path.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The den of the Lizardmen
  You have entered the den of the Lizardmen, the skins of many animals lie
on the floor or hang from the rocky walls.  Even here the moss grows on the
rock, and bones are strewn over the uneven floor.  Painted skins on the
walls show various states of a hunt, and there is evidence in one corner of
someone's work on a new bow.  The smell here is wild and unpleasant, and you
sense that you are being watched, though it is impossible to tell what
direction the watcher is staring from.  It may be best to leave while you
have a chance.  Perhaps you have already stayed too long.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Grand City of Aylor - Southern Entrance (G) (2190)

A Light Provisions Room (G)
  Calmness, warmth and serenity are the three first impressions you get 
from the large underground dome.  Two rows of elegantly curved, white
marble pillars lead all the way up to a bright white statue of Light's 
deity, Radience, standing there with open arms to welcome those in
need of help and the downtrodden.  The soft pure light coming from 
the columns bathe the dome in a soft glow, inviting you to come closer
and bask in it's warmth.  A deep soothing voice comes from your left :
'Is there anything Light can do to help you on your perilous way?'
When you turn towards the voice, you immediately notice the wrinkles
around the woman's bright green eyes, the graying of the once blonde
hair and the still athletic posture and tread as she approaches.
Upon coming closer she falls silent and only the white robes rustle
softly against her, she looks at you with a surprising freshness
and deep-rooted intelligence.  The stylish hand-and-a-half sword
hanging on her weathered belt warns you that she's always on her toes,
probably because evil can lurk everywhere, but still she smilingly
invites you : 'We also sell potions and other goods, if that's what 
you're looking for.'

[ Exits: north east (south) west up ]
     A small pile of gold coins.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) EmJay the Shaman.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The edge of a steamy marsh (G)
  As you turn off the swampy path, you realize that the loggers back in Aylor 
were not as drunk as they should have been from all the Firebreather they had
been drinking. Clearly visible, now that the loggers have chopped through the
undergrowth and the trees, is the trail you followed to see for yourself if 
the wild stories the loggers were telling were spun out of firebreather, or 
if a real adventure could be here. You stand at the very edge of the steaming
wetland, hearing the small chitterings, buzzings and splashes that are 
associated with places such as this; however, there is also a very faint 
chanting on the breeze that doesn't belong here. As you look around, you 
notice that like any marshland or wetland, this one is full of greenery, 
though there is a multitude of colors from flowers, insects, and decay mixed 
with the trees. As you continue to look, you notice three paths branching 
from this point, going deeper into the marsh, and of course, the way back to 
the swampy path.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A beautifully feathered duck is at home in the marshlands.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.
A very large brown bear searches through the undergrowth for food.
(Hidden) (White Aura) A human stalks the marshlands, hunting food.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

eqsearch
Syntax: eqsearch all         - show all wear locs with a better item.
      : eqsearch <item>      - compare searchable equipment to item.
      : eqsearch <wear loc>  - find searchable equipment in wear loc.

See 'help eqsearch' for full compare syntax and options.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Eastern Yvan Park (2199)

Approaching a Vast Complex of Ruins
  Exploring the eastern edges of Yvan Park you discover a vast complex of 
ruins to the north. A massive tree, whose trunk is almost entirely 
covered with tightly wound vines, has long since reclaimed the marble 
of the forgotten temple. The entire locale is now serving as the 
arboreous outpost of the Amazons. Toxophilite, the retired Amazon 
Champion, is surrounded by floating orchid petals as she patiently 
waits for travellers seeking her guidance.

[ Exits: north west ]
Peaceful Toxophilite is prepared for training & guidance.

>>    *[NOEXP]* An Overgrown Temple
  
Upon entering the ruined complex, you find yourself surrounded by a 
surprising array of flora and fauna. To the east you see a brightly 
lit room and hear the sound of hammerfalls echoing from within. To the west 
you spot a crumbling doorway with the words, "Hall of Ancestors" engraven 
above it. At the back of the chamber, you see a grand spiralling staircase
with a myriad of ancestral spirits perched upon its treds.

Chamber of Darkness
  You find yourself inside a darkened chamber that has been fashioned 
out of the hollow tree. Crumbling stones can be seen within the 
wooden walls of the chamber, having long since been partially absorbed by 
the cyclopean timber. Despite the darkness, you discern a woven ladder 
leading to top of the chamber with a sign beside it stating, "The Shop 
Above the Canopy." On the back wall, there is a braided wooden 
basket suspended from thick vines.

Lv 109  G 3027990 | Chamber of Darkness (EWU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Past the Northern Gate
  Walking through the gates you look about you and see mostly thatch huts and 
training fields. The amazons go about their daily routine. You see several 
of the veteran warriors working with the trainees, schooling them in the ways
of combat just off to the south. To the west you hear a loud noise coming 
from the nearest of the huts. You are about to go investigate when an old 
woman comes up to you and introduces herself as Miranda. "Welcome to the 
proving grounds of The Tribes, care to test yourself in the traditional ways 
of the Amazon? Let's see....what creature that has been plaguing us can I 
have you slay?" says Miranda with a twinkle in her eye.

Shop Above the Canopy

The Training Circle (G)
  As you head on further south through the encampment you come across the

drills with weapons, combat formations and general physical to some new 
trainees. "You, there, what is your name?" She shouts. A muscular wolfen 
answers "Kallendbor M'am." "Attack me Kallendbor...NOW!" Shouts Lessandra.
Kallendbor leaps into the air with a ferocious strike that would rip a man in
half but Lessandra easily sidesteps and sends him spinning with one fluid 
motion. "You see students, it's not the size of your opponent that really 
matters, but what his current position own force against him. All because I 
knew where to move and more importantly how to move my opponent. Now go and 
do your daily line drills." Lessandra lectures. She then turns her gaze 
towards you and asks "How may I help you?" 

[ Exits: north south west ]
     (Magic) This fur is soft and hairy.
     It's just a dented can with some goo inside.
Lessandra, Amazon Champion, is here teaching the day's lesson.

w
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Kayapos Trading Grounds
  West of the training fields you come to a large clearing that is strewn 
about with goods. Some look as though they have been plundered from other 
cultures outside of the Jungle, while some appear to be of Amazonian make.
This is where the Kayapos tribe brings goods for trade with the rest of the 
Tribes of Amazon. Shilo Enupe alKayapo seems to be the one in charge here, 
directing her subordinates to make sure all goods are traded fairly and 
quickly. Further west you see a small hut where many of the other Kayapos 
enter with members of other tribes. 

[ Exits: east west ]
Shilo the Amazon Trader is dusting off the shelves.

Lv 109  G 3027990 | The Kayapos Hut (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Yanomami Circle of Harmony
  This great circle is where all the Tribes of the Amazon meet to settle 
disputes and agree upon mandates that affect their people as a whole. There 
are logs set out for sitting in an amphitheater style, fanning out from the 
western half of the circle. Anyone who wishes to speak may do so, as long as
they do it with respect and wait their turn. The Yanomami mediators maintain 
the circle, as well as conduct the rites and rituals of the Amazons that keep
them bonded as a people.

d
Beneath the Circle of Harmony
  The entrance to this cavern is cleverly hidden beneath a stone in the 
circle of harmony. Here, the Kayapos bring their greatest creations, 
reserved for only the most elite of amazon warriors in all the tribes.
Toarasha, the greatest witchwoman the tribes have ever known, resides here.
Her unique talents are used day and night to place protective enchantments 
upon the artifacts, so that the amazons will be even more terrible and great 
in battle against the enemies of the jungle.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Grand City of Aylor - Southern Entrance (G) (2242)

A Light Provisions Room (G)
  Calmness, warmth and serenity are the three first impressions you get 
from the large underground dome.  Two rows of elegantly curved, white
marble pillars lead all the way up to a bright white statue of Light's 
deity, Radience, standing there with open arms to welcome those in
need of help and the downtrodden.  The soft pure light coming from 
the columns bathe the dome in a soft glow, inviting you to come closer
and bask in it's warmth.  A deep soothing voice comes from your left :
'Is there anything Light can do to help you on your perilous way?'
When you turn towards the voice, you immediately notice the wrinkles
around the woman's bright green eyes, the graying of the once blonde
hair and the still athletic posture and tread as she approaches.
Upon coming closer she falls silent and only the white robes rustle
softly against her, she looks at you with a surprising freshness
and deep-rooted intelligence.  The stylish hand-and-a-half sword
hanging on her weathered belt warns you that she's always on her toes,
probably because evil can lurk everywhere, but still she smilingly
invites you : 'We also sell potions and other goods, if that's what 
you're looking for.'

     A small pile of gold coins.

Greenwart Swamp (2209)

By Agroth's marsh (2208)

The edge of a steamy marsh (G)
  As you turn off the swampy path, you realize that the loggers back in Aylor 
were not as drunk as they should have been from all the Firebreather they had
been drinking. Clearly visible, now that the loggers have chopped through the
undergrowth and the trees, is the trail you followed to see for yourself if 
the wild stories the loggers were telling were spun out of firebreather, or 
if a real adventure could be here. You stand at the very edge of the steaming
wetland, hearing the small chitterings, buzzings and splashes that are 
associated with places such as this; however, there is also a very faint 
chanting on the breeze that doesn't belong here. As you look around, you 
notice that like any marshland or wetland, this one is full of greenery, 
though there is a multitude of colors from flowers, insects, and decay mixed 
with the trees. As you continue to look, you notice three paths branching 
from this point, going deeper into the marsh, and of course, the way back to 
the swampy path.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A beautifully feathered duck is at home in the marshlands.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A bandit sneaks around the marshes, looking for treasure.
A very large brown bear searches through the undergrowth for food.

The den of the Lizardmen
  You have entered the den of the Lizardmen, the skins of many animals lie
on the floor or hang from the rocky walls.  Even here the moss grows on the
rock, and bones are strewn over the uneven floor.  Painted skins on the
walls show various states of a hunt, and there is evidence in one corner of
someone's work on a new bow.  The smell here is wild and unpleasant, and you
sense that you are being watched, though it is impossible to tell what
direction the watcher is staring from.  It may be best to leave while you
have a chance.  Perhaps you have already stayed too long.  

[ Exits: east ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Edge (G)
  You are standing in a sparsely furnished, shadowy room.  A grubby window
on the far wall looks out upon what may be gardens.  A sign hangs on one
wall.  You notice a giant green sucker propped up in one corner.  It looks a
bit moldy, but still delicious.  Near another wall there is a desk.  Is that
someone sitting behind it?

INFO: The player rankings have been updated.

You feel yourself slow down.

Global Quest: Global Quest # 4389 has been won by Roronoa - 67th win.

INFO: New post #50288 in forum Ideas from Cruel Subj: Morgue Flag in Homes.. Again.

Your force shield shimmers then fades away.

Your rage ebbs.

The magic circle around you shimmers and fades away.
You are no longer able to breathe underwater.
ca underwater

You feel gills growing on your neck!

[*Daily Blessing*] 2520/2520 HP  3078/3093 MP  2245/2245 mv  843tnl  
Lv 109  G 3025425 | The Edge (N)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 


Enter the command to move to the portal destination
say gardens
You say 'gardens'
Lyx says 'Is that really what you are here for? Enjoy your journey then.'
Lyx mumbles a mysterious incantation as he looks into your eyes.
You dissolve and materialize in a garden of rock.
Rock Garden
  An austere rock garden extends in every direction beneath an ashen sky. 
Intended once as a zone of pure contemplation, the garden is now animated by
an odd assortment of rock creatures.  Enigmatic stones catch your eye.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) An ancient chalk snake slithers across your path.

Rose Ether
  You float in a seemingly endless catacomb of rose ether.  This thick,
sweet, gaseous substance varies in viscosity and is at some points
impassable.  Visibility is low.  Strange creatures appear and vanish with
startling frequency.

sweet, gaseous substance varies in viscosity and is at some points
impassable.  Visibility is low.  Strange creatures appear and vanish with
startling frequency.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (2227)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Great Andolor Highway (2224)

The Grand City of Aylor - Southern Entrance (G) (2223)

A Light Provisions Room (G)
  Calmness, warmth and serenity are the three first impressions you get 
from the large underground dome.  Two rows of elegantly curved, white
marble pillars lead all the way up to a bright white statue of Light's 
deity, Radience, standing there with open arms to welcome those in
need of help and the downtrodden.  The soft pure light coming from 
the columns bathe the dome in a soft glow, inviting you to come closer
and bask in it's warmth.  A deep soothing voice comes from your left :
'Is there anything Light can do to help you on your perilous way?'
When you turn towards the voice, you immediately notice the wrinkles
around the woman's bright green eyes, the graying of the once blonde
hair and the still athletic posture and tread as she approaches.
Upon coming closer she falls silent and only the white robes rustle
softly against her, she looks at you with a surprising freshness
and deep-rooted intelligence.  The stylish hand-and-a-half sword
hanging on her weathered belt warns you that she's always on her toes,
probably because evil can lurk everywhere, but still she smilingly
invites you : 'We also sell potions and other goods, if that's what 
you're looking for.'

[ Exits: north east (south) west up ]
     A small pile of gold coins.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
